subject: Technology
title: The Birth of Firefox
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Birth of Firefox.

hook.text: When Netscape died, its code didn't vanish. The company released it as open source.

buildup.text: A small team of volunteers rebuilt the browser from scratch under the Mozilla project.

discovery.text: In 2004, they launched Firefox. It was fast, customizable, and free from corporate control.

twist.text: Firefox introduced extensions, letting users add features the developers never imagined.

climax.text: Within two years, Firefox captured 20% of the market. Open source could compete.

punchline.text: Netscape died so Firefox could live.

quiz.question: How was Firefox created?
options: Microsoft spun it off from Internet Explorer
